# The `PassManager` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Manages a sequence of passes over a particular unit of IR. <a href="#details">More...</a>

class llvm::PassManager&lt;IRUnitT, AnalysisManagerT, ExtraArgTs&gt;</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Manages a sequence of passes over a particular unit of IR.

A pass manager contains a sequence of passes to run over a particular unit of IR (e.g. Functions, Modules). It is itself a valid pass over that unit of IR, and when run over some given IR will run each of its contained passes in sequence. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> managers are the primary and most basic building block of a pass pipeline.

When you run a pass manager, you provide an <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/analysismanager">AnalysisManager&lt;IRUnitT&gt;</a></code> argument. The pass manager will propagate that analysis manager to each pass it runs, and will call the analysis manager&#39;s invalidation routine with the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/preservedanalyses">PreservedAnalyses</a> of each pass it runs.

Definition at line 161 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/passmanager-h">PassManager.h</a>.

### addPass() {#a3b988beeca0390fa8fa653d17bded384}

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/passmanager-h/#l00195">195</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/passmanager-h">PassManager.h</a>.

### addPass() {#aa3e132679321009293a0289913d8b15b}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename PassT&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;MINSIZE std::enable&#95;if&#95;t&lt; std::is&#95;same&#95;v&lt; PassT, PassManager &gt; &gt; llvm::PassManager&lt; IRUnitT, AnalysisManagerT, ExtraArgTs &gt;::addPass (PassT &amp;&amp; Pass)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
When adding a pass manager pass that has the same type as this pass manager, simply move the passes over.

This is because we don&#39;t have use cases rely on executing nested pass managers. Doing this could reduce implementation complexity and avoid potential invalidation issues that may happen with nested pass managers of the same type.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/passmanager-h/#l00211">211</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/passmanager-h">PassManager.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
